Game is cheap and even cheaper if you know where to look. It didn't run perfectly but better then some old games I have tried. 185758241.review:
It seems quite evident that this game was made for the Xbox Kinect or something similar.  

[h3]Pros:[/h3]
-Visuals are great.
-Combat is somewhat intuitive.
-The hook of the story is great! 

[h3]Cons:[/h3]
-Plays like a demo.
-Story is [b]WAY[/b] too short. Once you get past the first act, it feels rushed. 
-Level maps are far too small.
-Each act of the story is painfully short
-No open world exploration
-Collectibles aren't satisfying

This game had potential if it was given far more attention and patience than it got from development.  Each act should've been longer, to the tune of hours rather than minutes.  Exploring the map does not feel fulfilling.  The phalanx formations and siege tactics should have had more frequent use.  The story, again, far too short and deserved hours upon hours of more content.  This could have been an amazing game, Game of the Year even. If it was the producer, the publisher or someone else cutting corners to just get a product on the market, shame on you. This game deserved so much more.

Купил, поиграл. Через 30 минут з**б*л*. Ну думаю ниче страшного, только начало же, потом по-любому ноавые приемы будут, и оружия точно навалят.

185652431.review:
+ Со скидкой очень дешево
+ Оптимальная продолжительность
+ Хорошая графика, несмотря на год игры
+ Идёт в 60 фпс на стим деке (в больших локациях бывают просадки до 40, но не критично)

- Трёхкнопочный геймплей. Через полчаса игра уже не может предложить тебе что-то новое.
- Анимации казней слишком долгие. Первые 15 минут ты кайфуешь, как ты элегантно проходишь QTE, смотришь на добивания в слоумо. А потом они тебя всё больше напрягают. На каждый QTE в слоумо, а их за казнь до 4 штук. Под конец игры они уже достают настолько, что перестаёшь стараться и жмёшь что угодно на "Удар рекрута", лишь бы побыстрее закончить.
- Казней не так много, как кажется на первый взгляд.
- Двойные казни процентах в 70 работают очень криво. Перестал их траить довольно быстро, потому что либо расстояние между врагами слишком большое, либо почему-то еще активируется одиночная казнь.
- Душные боссы. Особенно последние два. Ударами ты их не пробиваешь, они ставят блок. Удар щитом на них практически не работает, тоже парируют. Поэтому приходится всё время ждать только их атак и ставить блок или уворачиваться.

Последний час еле доиграл. Особенно последний босс и этот финальный "коридор" из преторианцев. Это пи*дец. Будь игра длиннее, точно бы был отрицательный отзыв.

185623081.review: 一个小巧精致的神选复仇故事，叙事手法很高明，通过倒叙一场场战役把角色成长曲线构建起来，这种凝练的叙事很好地掩盖了游戏核心玩法的扁平和枯燥：重复的qte，缺乏深度的动作模组，在五个小时左右的流程里让玩家不至于太过审美疲劳。罗马之子在音效、人物惯性、打击质感、动作衔接方面的调教都非常优秀，qte处决敌人时的实时运镜也不会让动画切入过于僵硬，带来了非常流畅刺激的砍杀体验。在斗兽场杀死康莫德斯的章节是本作的高潮也是闪光点，玩家需要在斗兽场快速变换的人造场景中重现先前章节中的战役，而当时被窝囊地俘虏的康莫德斯现在却在高处将战功据为己有，这不仅让游戏的几个章节形成结构上的呼应，更与玩家在这些战役中一刀一刀砍过来的亲身经历产生反差制造出强烈的戏剧张力，用一种游戏作为交互性艺术特有的手法来表现出罗马君权的虚伪，堪称利用游戏叙事的典范。另外本作的画面表现也异常惊艳，让人难以相信这是一部十几年前的作品，总体是一部各个方面完成度都很高的爽快直接的动作佳作。

185525185.review:
Обзор на игру Ryse: Son of Rome

Ryse: Son of Rome — это экшн-игра от третьего лица, разработанная Crytek и выпущенная в 2013 году. Игра переносит нас в Древний Рим и рассказывает историю центуриона Мариуса Тита, который жаждет мести за убийство своей семьи. Ryse выделяется своей великолепной графикой, зрелищными сражениями и кинематографичной постановкой.

Сюжет:

Сюжет Ryse: Son of Rome разворачивается в альтернативной истории Римской империи, где варварские племена угрожают ее существованию. Игрок берет на себя роль Мариуса Тита, римского центуриона, который переживает личную трагедию и отправляется в захватывающее путешествие, полное битв, интриг и мести. Мариус — это персонаж, чья мотивация понятна и вызывает сопереживание. Сюжет игры, хотя и не претендует на оригинальность, достаточно захватывающий и держит в напряжении до самого финала.

Геймплей:

Геймплей Ryse: Son of Rome представляет собой комбинацию ближнего боя и QTE (Quick Time Events) сцен. Основные особенности игрового процесса:

•  Ближний бой: Боевая система основана на использовании меча и щита. Игрок может наносить удары, блокировать атаки, контратаковать и проводить казни.
•  QTE-сцены: В игре много QTE-сцен, которые используются для казни врагов и выполнения других действий. Они сделаны очень зрелищно и эффектно.
•  Командование легионом: В некоторых моментах игрок может командовать римским легионом, отдавая приказы и участвуя в масштабных сражениях.
•  Прокачка персонажа: Мариус может улучшать свои навыки и получать новые способности, что делает его более эффективным в бою.

Графика и атмосфера:

Графика Ryse: Son of Rome на момент выхода была одной из лучших на игровом рынке. Детализированные персонажи, реалистичные локации, великолепные спецэффекты и кинематографичная постановка создают впечатляющую атмосферу Древнего Рима. Звуковое сопровождение также находится на высоком уровне, что усиливает погружение в игровой мир.

Плюсы:

•  Великолепная графика: Игра выглядит очень красиво и реалистично.
•  Зрелищные бои: Боевая система и QTE-сцены делают сражения очень эффектными и захватывающими.
•  Кинематографичная постановка: Игра ощущается как интерактивный фильм.
•  Интересный сюжет: Сюжет игры, хоть и не лишен клише, достаточно увлекательный и динамичный.
•  Атмосфера Древнего Рима: Игра отлично передаёт атмосферу древнеримской культуры и военного быта.

Минусы:

•  Ограниченность геймплея: Боевая система со временем может наскучить, так как она достаточно однообразна.
•  Слабая свобода действий: Игрок в основном следует сюжетной линии и не имеет большой свободы в исследовании мира.
•  QTE-сцены: QTE-сцены могут раздражать некоторых игроков из-за своей повторяемости.

Вывод:

Ryse: Son of Rome — это красивая и зрелищная игра, которая предлагает захватывающие сражения и динамичный сюжет. Она отлично подойдет тем, кто любит экшн-игры с историческим сеттингом и кинематографичной подачей. Однако, если вы ищете игру с глубоким геймплеем и свободой действий, то Ryse может вас разочаровать. В целом, это качественный и интересный проект, который стоит попробовать любителям жанра.

185400674.review:
Ryse: Son of Rome é um jogo que impressiona de cara. Os gráficos são lindos, e os cenários fazem você se sentir dentro da Roma antiga. É realmente de encher os olhos!

O combate, por outro lado, é bem simples. Ele não tem muita profundidade, mas até que diverte em alguns momentos, especialmente se você não estiver esperando algo muito elaborado. Acho que o fato de o jogo ser curto é uma vantagem aqui, porque, se fosse mais longo, provavelmente acabaria ficando repetitivo.

O que realmente me surpreendeu foi a história. Ela é muito boa e prende você até o fim. E o último ato? Simplesmente incrível! É aquele tipo de final que deixa uma ótima impressão e faz tudo valer a pena.

No geral, Ryse: Son of Rome é um jogo bonito, com uma história legal e divertido na medida certa. Não é perfeito, mas entrega bem o que se propõe. Pra mim, merece um 7/10.

185182032.review:
Ryse: Son of Rome – Ein zeitloser Klassiker, der selbst 2025 noch begeistert

Die römische Legende lebt weiter

Es gibt wenige Spiele, die im Laufe der Jahre ihre Faszination bewahren und noch heute für Staunen sorgen – Ryse: Son of Rome ist definitiv eines davon. Auch im Jahr 2025 hinterlässt es bei jedem Durchgang einen bleibenden Eindruck, als wäre es ein neu erschienenes Meisterwerk. Ein Spiel, das nicht nur für seine beeindruckende Grafik und seine epische Geschichte gefeiert wird, sondern auch für das fesselnde Gameplay, das eine unvergessliche Reise in das antike Rom bietet.

Ein grafisches Meisterwerk: Die CryEngine in Bestform

Selbst nach all den Jahren bleibt Ryse: Son of Rome ein absoluter Augenschmaus. Dank der CryEngine von Crytek hat das Spiel einen grafischen Glanz, der selbst viele heutige Produktionen in den Schatten stellt. Die detaillierten Umgebungen, die riesigen Schlachtfelder und die prachtvolle Darstellung Roms lassen das antike Reich lebendig wirken. Besonders in 4K-Auflösung entfaltet sich die Schönheit des Spiels in vollen Zügen. Jede Szene, jede Schlacht wirkt wie aus einem Historienepos – und das Beste: Auch im Jahr 2025 kann das Spiel problemlos mithalten, was die visuelle Qualität angeht. Es ist ein Paradebeispiel dafür, wie gut ein Spiel gealtert sein kann.

Die packende Geschichte von Marius Titus: Rache und Erlösung

Die Geschichte von Ryse: Son of Rome ist ebenso episch wie die Schlachten, die sie begleitet. Du schlüpfst in die Rolle des Legionärs Marius Titus, der den Mord an seiner Familie durch brutale Barbaren miterlebt. Dieser Schicksalsschlag führt ihn auf einen Pfad der Rache, der ihn durch die blutigen Auseinandersetzungen im britischen Grenzgebiet bis hin zur Hauptstadt des römischen Imperiums führt. Doch hinter der Geschichte von Rache und Rachegelüsten verbirgt sich auch eine tiefere, tragische Erzählung über Macht, Verrat und die Grenzen des menschlichen Ehrgeizes.

Die düstere und emotionale Reise von Marius wird von einer Reihe faszinierender Charaktere begleitet, die den Spieler immer tiefer in die Machtkämpfe des antiken Roms ziehen. Die Entwicklung von Marius vom einfachen Soldaten zum mächtigen General ist packend und gut inszeniert. Inmitten von Intrigen und Verrat muss er entscheiden, was wichtiger ist: die Rache an den Mördern seiner Familie oder das Schicksal des römischen Reiches.

Gameplay, das süchtig macht: Brutale Kämpfe und cineastische Action

Der wahre Reiz von Ryse: Son of Rome liegt im Gameplay. In der Rolle von Marius kämpfst du dich durch Horden von Feinden, die du mit präzisen Takedowns und brutalen Finishern besiegst. Jedes Kämpfen fühlt sich wie eine Szene aus einem epischen Actionfilm an, und die detaillierten Animationen sorgen für ein nahezu filmisches Erlebnis. Das Kampfsystem ist tiefgründig und fordert eine perfekte Mischung aus Timing, Taktik und Reflexen, um das Maximum aus den brutalen Auseinandersetzungen herauszuholen. Doch das eigentliche Highlight sind die eindrucksvollen Takedown-Animationen, die jedes Kampf-Erlebnis zu einem einzigartigen Spektakel machen. Jede Bewegung ist flüssig, präzise und absolut befriedigend – ein wahrer Genuss für Action-Fans.

Obwohl das Spiel auf einem hohen Schwierigkeitsgrad durchaus herausfordernd ist, sorgt es auch auf einem gemütlicheren Durchgang für jede Menge Spaß und Spannung. Die Spielzeit ist angenehm kurz – etwa 10 Stunden, was es zu einem perfekten Erlebnis für Zwischendurch macht, ohne dass sich die Motivation verliert. Die Mischung aus packender Story und intensiven Kämpfen sorgt dafür, dass du das Spiel immer wieder durchspielen möchtest, um all die Takedown-Animationen und epischen Szenen zu erleben.

Fazit: Ein zeitloser Klassiker, der auch 2025 begeistert

Auch Jahre nach seiner Veröffentlichung bleibt Ryse: Son of Rome ein Meisterwerk, das in jeder Hinsicht überzeugt. Die Grafiken, die packende Geschichte, das süchtig machende Gameplay – all das zusammen macht das Spiel auch 2025 noch zu einem Erlebnis, das seinesgleichen sucht. Wenn du ein Fan von Actionspielen bist und die römische Geschichte in all ihrer Brutalität erleben möchtest, ist Ryse: Son of Rome definitiv ein Titel, den du nicht verpassen solltest.

Die beeindruckende Präsentation, die tiefgründige Story und die unglaublichen Kämpfe machen es zu einem Spiel, das selbst heute noch ein wahres Meisterwerk ist. Wer in die Welt von Ryse eintaucht, erlebt nicht nur ein Spiel, sondern ein unvergessliches Abenteuer, das immer wieder zu neuen Entdeckungen und Erlebnissen einlädt.

185135923.review:
Ryse: Son of Rome is a third person action adventure game originally released as a release title for the Xbox One back in 2013. It's been nearly a decade since its release, and there's been no follow up to this short but novel effort of a roman story.

The story follows Marius Titus, a legionary, whom has his family murdered, which sees him rising in ranks and fighting in Britannia against Boudica and her father king Oswald, before returning home to enact his vengeance upon the corrupt and decadent people that wronged him, meanwhile Rome is falling around him.

There's an element of mystical meddling, with various gods appearing throughout the game, though it isn't expressly stated who or what they are, though it stands to reason that the female spirit whom is the one pushing Marius' revengeance, is Nemesis. She also seemingly is not letting Marius die until his task is complete. While the other, the male spirit, is pulling the strings of the Emperor of Rome. This all being a game for them, a game with rules, as stated by Nemesis towards the end. Though, for the humans, they are little more than puppets in the god's play.

There isn't much resolution to this aspect of the story, leaving behind little more then an action romp through Ryse's rather short stay, totaling around 5 hours, which sees you slaughtering endless barbarians before facing off against Nero's Praetorians. Visually the game still holds up a decade later, when it released for PC originally it was stunning game, and while it doesn't hold up to modern contemporaries, its one that has held up fairly well despite it's age.

The combat is probably the games weakpoint, it's a reactionary quick time fest, that sees you chaining left and right mouse button combos, to overcome the enemies of the game, before executing them with more QTE events. It's a rather shallow system, that with a tacked on upgrade system, doesn't offer a great experience.

Add to that a camera that's practically glued to the back of Marious' head, and you are fighting the camera at times as much as the barbarians.

Ultimately there aren't many Roman media around, and there hasn't been many in the past decade either, so Ryse still warrants a playthrough.

184864222.review:
É um jogo que eu queria jogar desde antes do lançamento do Xbox One, eu assistia o trailer do console e a apresentação do game era demais.
Hoje em dia percebo que não era tanto pelo jogo, mas mais pelo que ele significava, a evolução, a novidade, mais do que a qualidade dele em si.

Depois de pegar ele pra jogar, vejo que é um jogo bastante repetitivo, com uma história bem fraca, personagens de pouca profundidade, caricatos e até mal desenvolvidos.
De todo modo, não foi uma coisa ruim perseguir esse jogo por tanto tempo, eu terminei ele pela primeira vez lá em 2017, 4 anos depois de tanto ansiá-lo, e volto aqui 11 anos depois pra fazer essa review.

Fato é, no meio do caminho acabei descobrindo muitas coisas legais, como dizem os budistas "não é a chegada, mas o caminho".
Ter pego um PC Gamer, jogar diversos outros jogos tão mais interessantes e até outras coisas mais, parecem ser interessantes que o jogo em si.

É até engraçado por ser um "paralelo" com a história de Ryse, como o Zangado mesmo disse "às vezes, amamos algo com tanta intensidade, e esse amor não é correspondido"
Nem sempre a realidade é da mesma forma que nós imaginamos, todavia, isso não significa que não valha a pena imaginar.

Aceitar o que fica no caminho, nem sempre o que você deseja tende a ser bom, e nem tudo o que você não consegue é por um motivo ruim. 
Aceitar esse caminho é também se abrir para coisas muito melhores, que nem você mesmo poderia ter imaginado. Sou grato por ter jogado o jogo, apesar dele ser bem ruim.

184848150.review: Ryse: Son of Rome is an action-packed hack-and-slash game set in ancient Rome, offering a visually stunning portrayal of the Roman Empire. The game’s graphics are certainly its standout feature, with realistic character models, dynamic lighting, and breathtaking landscapes that fully immerse players in its brutal world. The combat system is simple yet satisfying, relying heavily on quick-time events (QTEs) to execute brutal finishing moves. While the story follows Marius Titus on his quest for vengeance and justice, the narrative is fairly straightforward, often leaning into familiar tropes of revenge and honor. Despite its visual appeal, the game must be criticized for its repetitive gameplay, particularly in its combat sequences, which can feel monotonous after extended play that is why it is more enjoyable to play in intervals. The game’s linearity and limited multiplayer options also detract from its overall depth. Nevertheless, it remains an enjoyable experience for fans of cinematic, story-driven action games, especially those with an appreciation for Roman history and mythology.

Сюжет, в целом, стар как мир, о семье, предательстве и мести. Большинство поворотов ты уже знаешь заранее. Но наблюдать за всем этим в любом случае интересно, благодаря офигенным постановочным сценам, которые мало чем уступают в своей проработанности фильмам. Прям очень это понравилось.
Боевка банальная немного, основанная на прожимание в тайминг нужных кнопок, но в целом это тоже не сильно напрягает. Спасибо огромному количеству анимаций добивания, еще и зависящих от игрового ландшафта. Летящие в разные стороны конечности, головы и кровь на твой экран... прям м... смак.
На фоне сегодняшнего повесточного кала выглядит прям очень выгодно, особенно учитывая что визуально мало чем уступает некоторым нынешним "квадрупл пупл A проектам".
Никаких багов, лагов, фризов и тд замечено мной не было. Но у меня и комп далеко не ведро.
Так что прям оч офигенные 7 часов в моей жизнь.

On this voyage, Pytheas circumnavigated and visited a considerable part of the British Isles. He was the first known Greek scientific visitor to see and describe the Arctic, polar ice, and the Celtic and Germanic tribes. He is also the first person on record to describe the midnight sun.  He reported name as Prettanike (Πρεττανική) and Brettaniai (Βρεττανίαι), for Britain and the British islands, which became Britannia, it is assumed that its Hellenised version was under Diodorus.

Pretanī is Britain, It is quite probable that the description of Britain given by the Greek writer Diodorus Siculus in the first century BC derives wholly or largely from Pytheas. What is of particular interest is that he calls the island "Pretannia" (Greek "Prettanikē"), that is "the island of the Pretani, or Priteni".

Diodorus was Greek historian, known for his universal history Bibliotheca Historica. Originally, it was a 40-volume monumental work, covering the history of the Mediterranean region from mythical times to his own lifetime, around 60/59 BCE.

In ancient Greek mythology, the "Hyperboreoi" were a people who lived in a northern paradise of perpetual sunshine beyond the reaches of the god of the north wind. Their name located them within the Greek world; it combined the prefix "hyper-," meaning "above," and "Boreas," the Greek name for the north wind.

The Hyperboreans were believed to live beyond the snowy Riphean Mountains, with Pausanias describing the location as "The land of the Hyperboreans, men living beyond the home of Boreas." Homer placed Boreas in Thrace, and therefore Hyperborea was in his opinion north of Thrace, in Dacia.

184467287.review:
Évaluation : 🌟🌟🌟 (3/5)
"Ryse: Son of Rome, un spectacle épique visuellement impressionnant mais limité par sa répétitivité."

Ryse: Son of Rome, développé par Crytek, est un jeu d’action et d'aventure en vue à la troisième personne qui plonge les joueurs dans la Rome antique. Avec ses graphismes exceptionnels, ses combats intenses et son histoire dramatique, il offre une expérience qui séduit par ses visuels mais peine à maintenir l'intérêt sur le long terme à cause d'une structure de gameplay répétitive.

Les Points Forts :
✅ Graphismes époustouflants : Dès les premières minutes, Ryse impressionne par ses graphismes. Les textures, les animations faciales et la modélisation des personnages sont d'une qualité remarquable, surtout pour un jeu sorti en 2013. L’ambiance de la Rome antique est soigneusement recréée, ce qui permet une immersion totale dans l’univers du jeu.

✅ Combats spectaculaires et fluides : Les combats sont visuellement impressionnants, avec des exécutions brutales et des mécaniques de parades et de contre-attaques qui ajoutent une dimension tactique. Les séquences de "QTE" (Quick Time Events) bien synchronisées rendent les exécutions encore plus intenses et satisfaisantes.

✅ Ambiance et scénario épiques : L’histoire de Marius Titus, un soldat romain cherchant à venger sa famille tout en naviguant dans les intrigues politiques et militaires de la Rome antique, est captivante. Le jeu regorge de scènes cinématographiques et de dialogues dramatiques, offrant une expérience proche d’un film d’action.

✅ Bande-son immersive : La musique, accompagnée d’effets sonores réalistes, ajoute à la grandeur de l'expérience, que ce soit lors des batailles en pleine arène ou pendant les moments plus introspectifs du jeu.

Les Points Faibles :
⚠️ Gameplay répétitif : L'une des principales critiques du jeu réside dans sa répétitivité. Les combats, bien qu'impressionnants au début, finissent par devenir mécaniquement redondants. Le système de "combats d'armées" se réduit souvent à une série de mouvements similaires, et les missions semblent parfois manquer de diversité.

⚠️ Problèmes de profondeur dans la progression : Le système de progression, qui vous permet de débloquer de nouvelles compétences et équipements, manque de réelle profondeur. Les options sont limitées et ne suffisent pas à rendre les combats plus intéressants à long terme.

⚠️ Manque de variété dans les missions : Bien que le jeu propose des missions variées dans son univers, celles-ci se réduisent souvent à des tâches répétitives comme éliminer des vagues d'ennemis ou remplir des objectifs spécifiques. Cela peut nuire à l'immersion et à l'engagement sur la durée.

⚠️ Campagne courte et linéaire : La campagne de Ryse est relativement courte, souvent autour de 6 à 8 heures, et se déroule de manière assez linéaire. Cela peut décevoir ceux qui cherchent une aventure plus ouverte ou plus longue.

⚠️ Mode multijoueur limité : Le mode multijoueur, qui vous place dans des arènes pour affronter des vagues d'ennemis, n’est pas aussi engageant qu’il pourrait l’être. Bien qu'il offre une certaine rejouabilité, il manque de profondeur et devient rapidement répétitif.

En conclusion :
Ryse: Son of Rome est un jeu visuellement impressionnant avec un gameplay fluide et une histoire engageante, mais il souffre de problèmes de répétitivité et de manque de profondeur. Il brille par ses graphismes et son ambiance cinématographique, mais ceux qui recherchent une expérience plus variée et longue risquent d’être déçus. Si vous êtes un amateur de spectacles visuels et de combats intenses, Ryse pourra néanmoins vous divertir pendant quelques heures.

🎮 Verdict final :
Un jeu spectaculaire à regarder mais qui manque de substance sur le long terme. Les combats, bien que spectaculaires, deviennent rapidement répétitifs, et l'expérience générale peut sembler un peu limitée.

⏳ Temps de jeu recommandé :

Campagne principale : 6 à 8 heures.
Multijoueur (coop) : 5 à 10 heures.
✨ Note personnelle : Ryse est un excellent choix pour une session rapide et visuellement impressionnante, mais il ne propose pas une expérience aussi mémorable que d’autres jeux de l’époque.

[h3] Ryse: Son of Rome [/h3] - это экшен-игра, выпущенная для Xbox One и PC, разработанная Crytek. Действие игры разворачивается в Древнем Риме, где игроки берут на себя роль Мария Тита, римского солдата, стремящегося отомстить за свою семью и защитить империю.

[h1] Графика и атмосфера [/h1]: Игра впечатляет своими великолепными графическими эффектами и детализированными локациями, которые создают атмосферу древнеримского мира.

[h1] Геймплей [/h1]: Основной акцент сделан на ближнем бою с использованием интуитивно понятной системы управления. Игроки могут выполнять комбо-атаки и контратаки, а также использовать различные тактики в сражениях. Однако игровой процесс может показаться однообразным из-за ограниченного разнообразия механик.

[h1] Сюжет [/h1]: История Мария насыщена драматическими моментами и предательством, но некоторые критики отмечают, что сюжет не всегда глубоко проработан.

[h1] Заключение: Ryse: Son of Rome [/h1] - это визуально впечатляющая игра с захватывающим боевым процессом, хотя ей не хватает разнообразия и глубины в сюжете. Игра подойдет любителям исторических экшенов и красивой графики.

As a Roman fanboy I bought this game years ago and have quietly sat on it until I finally decided to give it a spin over the Christmas break. Holy shizzle, do I feel like a fool for sitting on it for so long.

This is a fantastic game. Visually it is a very good looking game which holds up even now in 2024 which isn't too surprising given this was a headliner game for the Xbox One back in the day and had orgasmic graphics for the time, the combat is fast paced and exciting and the execution-system is really fun once you get into the swing of it. I really enjoyed the story as well, Marius is a good protagonist who we learn and grow with, both mechanically and story-ly as the missions progress, and the story isn't half bad either, it's a good story, the plot has serious and dark moments that are treated and done nicely and treats you like an adult with subject matter, and all around it's just a really fun game. Getting to march in step with my legionaries, form a testudo and then break and start lobbing pilums at the barbarian hordes is such a treat to do.

I absolutely can recommend picking this up, if you're a fan of a good hack and slash in Roman times. I ran through the game the first time on the 2nd difficulty to get to grips on it, and immediately started a new run on the highest difficulty because why the heck not. And though it has been ten years since and Crytek probably has no interest in creating a sequel to this gem, I would love to see a sequel to this game.

Dulce et decorum est pro patria mori.

184132703.review:
This game has alot of issues, going from technical issues, gameplay issues, to story issues, to even small things like the "Roman identity". The only thing Ryse has to offer really is obviously the technical leap for the xbox one, and repetitive cinematics. 
  
      Starting from the technical issues, it performs pretty badly on a powerful machine, has unbearable audio bugs on a consistent bases, and has bad problems with the controls. 
  You cannot change certain graphical settings unless you go into the files themselves and change it from there. All the graphical settings are worthless to have on max because it doesnt change the visuals and just tanks your performance, with constant stutters( again i have a pretty powerful pc).   
     The audio will completely become very scratchy and high pitched after every slightest scenery change which is constant, it also has the potential to crash out someones soundcard from what i have seen. Which is especially an issue when youre doing survival with someone and you have 900+ combo and still rising. 
  The controls can only be adjusted by getting a specific hotkey which forcibly remaps your keyboard like you would expect on a gaming mouse. But by doing so you will start to have issues with the controls themselves becoming unresponsive causing you to do considerably worse than if you were using regular controls. I did not have this issue because i used a controller, but the person i was 100% this had this problem
 
     Gameplay wise, Ryse has a ton of issues when it comes to basic combat, targeting, ability usage, enemy spawns during late stage survival, executions, progression, stats enemy variety, level variety.
     When it comes to basic combat, there is a noticable input delay when it comes to changing attack types, leaving you wide open for a counter attack which you have no ability to deflect, or dodge. This becomes especially apparent when dealing with special enemy types. You will be dealing with a group of them, and then one or more will perform a heavy attack which you have no way of dodging because of an input delay, or it wont let you during an attack animation, where sometimes it will let you perform other avenues of combat or dodge, other times it will not. This becomes a problem when you are trying to rack up a high combo multiplier for xp. 
      Ryse has a weird problem with its targeting mechanic, where unless your are actively targeting an enemy you are almost guaranteed to lose your combo almost immediately (and if not immediately then within 5 seconds), unless your chanting. Also you will at times be in combat with one enemy, then randomly your character will target another enemy from across the map mid combat. Again this becomes an issue when youre trying to build up your combo multiplier. 
  The focus abilities are essentially useless other than two. Mars pretty much does nothing, his damage gains dont last long, and damage is not essential to ryse anyways. Diana provides very small quantity of xp and just pushes enemies away, which is useful only on arena but is not as useful as the last 2. Jupiter and apollo provide focus (mana) and health respectfully. Their abilities are essentially the same with just a different boost and a different coat of paint. They essentially just stun enemies and sort of slow down time for them, which allows for easy combo gains with no repercussions. The problem comes when you are unables to cancel the ability because someone on the map is hidden and is affected by it, meaning your focus will drain and you will be unable to use that ability until you find him. Enemy spawn rates do not scale with time progression on survival. Meaning the limit is essentially 35 minutes because you are punished for killing to fast, but are forced to kill fast because the health drain demands it to be so. And from multiple runs after 35 min they just stop spawning. Leaving you just chanting to death like some viking trying to enter valhalla. 
      Executions dont always trigger, meaning you will be right next to an executable enemy just spinning your sword for the funsies, and will lead you to losing your combo multiplier. Another problem is the constant team executables, when trying to go for a double execute, you will end up in a forced team execute which will give less combo  than that sweet sweet double execute were trying to go for only for your teamate not be able to join you for that execute because he is dealing with his own crowd. They are also really repetitive, this is what  i mean by Ryse only truly having cinematics going for it. The executions become really stale after 2 hours, there are alot of them, but the triggers are rare, so you end up with the same executions for the 40th time in a row. 
      Progression is not a necessary to worry about for the most part. In the campaign, leveling things up is not very important, unless your are doing legendary, in which case the only thing you need to really level up is focus, and maybe health. In multiplayer you just pretty much stick to tier 2 gear until you reach tier 5 or preferably tier 6 gear.
       Other than health and focus, no other stats matter when it comes to gear, your xp multiplier is outweighed by the combo multiplier, same applies with the crowd bonus. You just want to spam apollos or jupiters ability to rack up a high combo count and youre pretty much set for the rest of the playthrough. Inventory space is not really needed unless you plan on doing certain arena matches but you will probably just end up doing survival dockyard for the xp grind. 
      In multiplayer the enemy types are always the same brutes, even if the level takes place in egypt, you will end up fighting vikings. Which i sort of understand. you can argue that the barbarians were captured and forced into fighting you in the gladiator arena, but either way there was more enemy variety in the campaign, they even took the time to model the second to last boss differently from his minions. They also use actual 3d models for the crowds in the background, which goes to show that they definitely had that ability.
      The levels are also just bland. The objectives are all the same. You go here to fight, then you run there to fight, with each map just having a fresh coat of paint. The only reason to even touch the multiplayer is the achievements. The only real variety that i noticed is in the survival maps,  where you deal with different obstacles on each map. But you will be spending almost exclusively all your time on dockyard for the xp.

      The story is not bad, but it isnt good either, mainly just forgettable. The only really interesting character i found was the first real antagonist that you meet, and that is only because his mannerisms were spot on. It isnt really explained why the g-ds have put rome in 
this position.
       The bosses are just lackluster. Most  of them other than the roman one are just regular special enemies with a higher health bar. Again Ryse was just a techincal leap for xbox to showcase, which is understandable but still not something worth thinking about after your done with it. 

      And the last part is really a nitpick, but ryse is also not true to the "roman identity". I understand that this is a roman fantasy, but it still has to follow certain rules that would apply to the roman culture. Leontius is a greek name, and any roman would be insulted to have their child named with a greek name. Marius is a aristocratic surname, who would name someone with a lastname. And we know that Marius is his first name, because he is reffered to as Marius son of Leontius. 

      Overall Ryse son of Rome is a janky piece of junk which should be forgotten about, and is slowly being forgotten as it has an average player count of about 70 people last time i checked, and which pissed me off to the point i decided to write an essay of how bad it is

183955749.review:
画面堪称一绝。游戏对罗马建筑、服饰以及场景的细节刻画极为细腻，从繁华的罗马城到战场上的血腥厮杀，每一个场景都栩栩如生。例如，在战斗场景中，盾牌上的纹理、士兵的铠甲以及周围环境的光影效果都极为逼真，让人仿佛置身于古罗马的战场之中。而且，游戏的色彩搭配也十分精妙，明亮的色调与昏暗的场景形成鲜明对比，进一步增强了游戏的视觉冲击力。游戏的战斗机制丰富多样，反击功能是一大亮点。玩家在战斗中可以通过准确的时机把握，进行反击，不仅能有效地防御敌人的攻击，还能给予敌人致命一击。这种机制让玩家在战斗中充满了成就感，也增加了游戏的策略性。例如，在面对不同类型的敌人时，玩家需要根据敌人的攻击方式和节奏来选择合适的反击时机，这使得战斗过程更加富有挑战性。小时候玩盗版的《罗马之子》，就被它独特的战斗风格和丰富的游戏内容所吸引。当时虽然没有完全领略到游戏的精髓，但已经对游戏中的战斗场景和角色留下了深刻的印象。长大补票重新体验后，更是被游戏的魅力所折服。从游戏的每一个细节中都能感受到制作团队的用心，无论是画面的精细度还是游戏机制的完善，都让我对这款游戏有了全新的认识。
总的来说，《罗马之子》是一款值得玩家深入体验的游戏。它不仅具有出色的画面表现和丰富的游戏机制，还能让玩家在游戏中感受到历史的厚重和文化的魅力。对于喜欢历史题材和动作游戏的玩家来说，这款游戏绝对不容错过。

183632363.review:
This game is a visual masterpiece. The graphics are absolutely stunning, and the character models are some of the most realistic I've ever seen. You'll feel like you're right there in the Colosseum, fighting for your life alongside Marius Titus.
Speaking of Marius, he's a compelling protagonist. You'll follow his journey from a young soldier to a seasoned warrior, and you'll experience all the highs and lows that come with it. The story is full of twists and turns, and it will keep you on the edge of your seat until the very end.
But Ryse isn't just a pretty face. The combat is also top-notch. It's visceral and satisfying, and you'll feel like a true gladiator every time you land a blow. There's also a good amount of depth to the combat, and you'll need to master a variety of combos and techniques to survive.
Overall, Ryse: Son of Rome is a must-play for anyone who loves action games. It's got everything you could want: stunning graphics, a compelling story, and satisfying combat. So what are you waiting for? Go out and buy it today!
And honey, let's be real, the gladiators in this game are hot. I mean, have you seen Marius? He's a total snack. And don't even get me started on the other gladiators. They're all so muscular and sweaty. It's enough to make a queen swoon.
So if you're looking for a game with some eye candy, Ryse is definitely the way to go. You won't be disappointed.
Now, go forth and conquer!

183617337.review:
This game feels like a classic macho action movie, historical inaccuracies and all. The "feel" of being the Roman legionnaire is captured perfectly despite all that.

The story is fairly straightforward, in that same action movie style, and sometimes that just feels refreshing even if some of it is a bit cringe. The graphics are great even today. The big set pieces and varied locations keep the game feeling fresh. The pacing is great as the game doesn't overstay its welcome. 

The combat does get very repetitive, and the boss fights especially at the end are uninspired. There is one where you literally fight the same enemy 3 times, just whittling down their health bar 3 times only to see it replenish and have to fight them again, no extra moves, no changes in their attack pattern, just fight them the same way as before. Again. To top it off, their moveset literally requires you to dodge for about 30 seconds to a minute before you can land a strike. So the boss fight lasts about 20 minutes simply because you have to keep rolling around and wait for them to get through the unblockable animations. This more than anything drags the game down, and I remember one of the times I've replayed this, I just quit once I got to the boring boss fights. 

There is also no built-in way to change control-mapping. This was a big issue for me coming from the Arkham and Mordor games where X is attack, Y is block, etc. This game's native control scheme threw off my rhythm, but I was able to remap it through Steam, I just had to remember that the button prompts in-game were  no longer accurate for some things.

Despite that, I've revisited this game 3 times over the last few years, which actually surprised me. Sometimes you just want a high-adrenaline, high-testosterone linear action game, and this is that. It doesn't try to be an RPG. It doesn't try to cater to every kind of player. And that's probably why I've come back to it when it's been long enough that I ask myself "Huh, was that Ryse: Son of Rome game any good?"
